Mini-Project #1


Goal: Analyze Netflix’s Top 10 data to identify the most popular programming on the platform.

Hi everyone, I’m Christopher Tan! I began my undergrad planning to pursue a career in accounting, but towards the end of my senior year, I took a handful of programming classes and discovered how much I enjoyed the problem solving aspect. That led me to pursuing my Masters in Statistics, where I could learn to make sense of large amounts of data as well as understanding statistical methodologies. I’m especially interested in ML and data science, since they bring together coding and statistical analysis in meaningful ways. Looking forward to meeting you folks!

Press Releases

Stranger Things Season 5: The Global Phenomenon Returns
Netflix proudly announces the upcoming fifth and final season of Stranger Things, one of the most-watched English-language TV shows in the platform’s history. Across its previous four seasons, the series has amassed over 2.9 billion total viewing hours, proving its unmatched global appeal. Stranger Things held a spot in the Top 10 for more than 350 weeks worldwide, appearing in over 90 countries. While other major hits like Wednesday and The Witcher have seen massive success, Stranger Things continues to lead as the gold standard for global engagement and storytelling. Fans everywhere are eagerly awaiting the final showdown in Hawkins later this year.


Netflix Celebrates Blockbuster Growth in India
India’s love for local storytelling continues to fuel Netflix’s growth in the region. Hindi-language films and TV shows have now spent over 200 weeks in India’s Top 10 charts, with recent hits like The Secret of Devkaali, achieving record-breaking viewership. Total hours viewed in India have surpassed 180 million, showing an expanding subscriber base and rising engagement across the country. With India now recognized as one of Netflix’s fastest-growing markets, the company continues to invest in local productions that connect deeply with audiences at home and abroad.


Japan’s Thrillers Take Center Stage on Netflix
Netflix Japan is riding a wave of suspense-driven storytelling, as homegrown thrillers climb the global charts. Titles such as Exit 8 have captivated millions with it’s blend of psychological and cinematic tension. In 2025, Japanese thrillers appeared in the Top 10 across more than 70 countries, marking a record year for international engagement. Viewers are drawn to Japan’s unique ability to fuse quiet drama with gripping mystery, creating shows that stay in the global Top 10 for weeks at a time. As Netflix invests further in Japan’s thriller genre, these stories continue to prove that intrigue knows no language barrier.
